meanings.sent1: The plants and animals in the ecosystem are interdependent.
meanings.sent2: In a team, players are interdependent on each other to win the game.
meanings.sent3: The interdependent relationship between bees and flowers ensures pollination.
meanings.sent4: The success of the project was interdependent on everyone completing their tasks.
meanings.sent5: The interdependent nature of the global economy became evident during the crisis.

meanings.sent1: The two companies are interdependent for their supply chain.
meanings.sent2: Family members are interdependent on each other for emotional support.
meanings.sent3: The interdependent partnership between the two countries led to prosperity.
meanings.sent4: The success of the show was interdependent on the actors' performances.
meanings.sent5: Their interdependent relationship grew stronger over time.

meanings.definition: Connected or related to each other
meanings.sent1: The characters in the story are interdependent in their journey.
meanings.sent2: The different subjects in school are interdependent for a well-rounded education.
meanings.sent3: The interdependent plot twists kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent4: The interdependent themes of the paintings reflected the artist's vision.
meanings.sent5: The interdependent events in history shaped the course of the nation.
